gesel 0.1.0
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • Gene set searches with the Gesel database

    Fetch sets for some genes

    fetchSetsForSomeGenes.Rd

    Fetch all sets that contain some genes in the Gesel database. This can be more efficient than fetchSetsForAllGenes if only a few genes are of interest.

    fetchSetsForSomeGenes(
  species,
  genes,
  fetch.file = downloadDatabaseFile,
  fetch.file.args = list(),
  fetch.range = downloadDatabaseRanges,
  fetch.range.args = list()
)

    Arguments

    species

    String containing the NCBI taxonomy ID of the species of interest.

    genes

    Integer vector containing gene indices. Each gene index refers to a row of the data frame returned by fetchAllGenes).

    fetch.file

    Function that accepts the name of the file in the Gesel database and returns an absolute path to the file.

    fetch.file.args

    Named list of arguments to pass to fetch.file.

    fetch.range

    Function that accepts at least two arguments - the name of the file in the Gesel database, and an integer vector of length 2 containing the zero-indexed half-open byte range to extract from the file (see downloadDatabaseRanges for details). It should return a string containing the contents of the specified byte range.

    fetch.range.args

    Named list of arguments to pass to fetch.file.

    Value

    List of integer vectors. Each vector corresponds to a gene in genes and contains the identities of the sets containing that gene. Each set is defined by its set index, which refers to a row of the data frame returned by fetchAllSets.

    Author

    Aaron Lun

    Examples

    first.gene <- fetchSetsForSomeGenes("9606", 1)
str(first.gene)
#> List of 1
#>  $ : int [1:68] 1327 2337 2366 3538 6639 8166 13182 13273 14384 17635 ...

# Sets containing the first gene
all.set.info <- fetchAllSets("9606")
head(all.set.info[first.gene[[1]],])
#>            name                  description size collection number
#> 1327 GO:0003674           molecular_function  710          1   1327
#> 2337 GO:0005576         extracellular region 1916          1   2337
#> 2366 GO:0005615          extracellular space 1865          1   2366
#> 3538 GO:0008150           biological_process  561          1   3538
#> 6639 GO:0031093 platelet alpha granule lumen   67          1   6639
#> 8166 GO:0034774      secretory granule lumen  115          1   8166
